about.header: Precision Genetic testing for personalized Care
about.subheader: ATENA Genomics is dedicated to making high-quality genetic testing based on next-generation sequencing (NGS) technology accessible and affordable for everyone. By offering easy-to-understand test results and personalized health insights, we help individuals take control of their well-being and support the shift toward more precise, preventive, and personalized healthcare.

marija.name: Dr. Marija Vujadinović
marija.title: Founder and CTO of ATENA Genomics

bio.part1: Dr. Marija Vujadinović, Founder and CTO of ATENA Genomics, brings over 15 years of expertise in molecular biotechnology, vaccine development, and GMP manufacturing. She focuses on advancing precision genetic testing to improve healthcare in the Balkans. Marija holds a PhD from the University of Amsterdam, where she specialized in adenoviral vectored vaccines, and dual MSc degrees from Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, combining molecular sciences with leadership.
bio.part2: At Janssen Pharmaceuticals, she played a key role in transitioning vaccines, including the Janssen COVID-19 vaccine, from research to clinical application. Her expertise spans vaccine design, GMP manufacturing, and regulatory compliance. Earlier roles at the University of Utah and VU Medical Center strengthened her skills in infectious disease research and molecular diagnostics.
bio.part3: Marija's work includes patents and publications in HPV and adenoviral technology. With additional certifications from Harvard in Genetic Testing and Cancer Genomics, she is committed to transforming healthcare in the Balkans, one genome at a time.

cancer_ngs_profiling.title: Cancer NGS Profiling
cancer_ngs_profiling.description: NGS in oncology offers precise tumor profiling, liquid biopsy analysis, hereditary cancer screening, and cancer drug resistance monitoring for early detection, tailored therapies and enhanced patient care.

genetic_disorders_ngs.title: Genetic Disorders NGS
genetic_disorders_ngs.description: NGS for early and precise detection of inherited genetic conditions, such as metabolic, neurological, developmental, and cardiovascular disorders, allowing for timely interventions and personalized treatments.

prenatal_genetic_risk_analysis.title: Prenatal and Newborn Genetic Screening
prenatal_genetic_risk_analysis.description: Non-Invasive Prenatal Testing (NIPT) and Expanded Newborn Screening using NGS aim to detect genetic and chromosomal abnormalities early, enabling personalized treatment plans and improving long-term health outcomes for fetuses and newborns.

genomic_response_to_pharmacotherapy.title: Pharmacogenomics
genomic_response_to_pharmacotherapy.description: Drug Response Prediction and Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs) testing using NGS helps tailor personalized treatments, reduce adverse effects, and improve patient outcomes by identifying genetic variations that influence drug efficacy and safety.

pathogen_ngs_profiling.title: Pathogen NGS Profiling
pathogen_ngs_profiling.description: NGS offers rapid and accurate pathogen identification, antimicrobial resistance (AMR) detection, viral genotyping, and outbreak investigation, for disease surveillance and effective public health responses.

client_specific_ngs_testing.title: Client-specific NGS Testing
client_specific_ngs_testing.description: Custom client-specific NGS solutions provide tailored genomic insights to address unique diagnostic, research, and analytical challenges with precision and efficiency.

contact_form.footer: For any additional information or enquiries you may have you can reach ATENA Genomics team at email:

subheader.subheader: ATENA Genomics offers advanced genetic analysis using next-generation sequencing (NGS). Our services include screening for inherited genetic disorders, identifying mutations linked to cancer, assessing how the body may respond to medications (pharmacogenomics), and early genetic screening after birth — with the possibility of tailored the testing based on your specific needs. All tests are performed using a simple, non-invasive buccal swab. For more information, contact our team at:

section3.title: How It Works
section3.description1: Quick and painless cheek swab that can be done in our clinic
section3.description2: State-of-the-art NGS technology to analyze your DNA with high precision
section3.description3: Comprehensive report with expert consultation to understand your results

GeneticDisorders.sub1: Genetic disorders can affect many different systems in the body — from how we process nutrients to how our brain, muscles, and immune system function. These conditions are often caused by changes in our DNA that are present from birth, even if no symptoms are immediately visible. With next-generation sequencing (NGS) technology, we can now identify these inherited risks early — using a simple, non-invasive cheek swab.
GeneticDisorders.sub2: ATENA Genomics offers a broad range of genetic NGS testing options to help you better understand your health. Below, you'll find an overview of the key categories — including proactive health screening, hereditary cancers, neurological and metabolic conditions, and more — all designed to support early detection, prevention, and personalized care.
GeneticDisorders.bottomCardHead: Ready to Explore Your Genetic Health?
GeneticDisorders.bottomCardText: Take the first step towards understanding your genetic profile with our comprehensive NGS testing options. Our team is here to guide you through the process and help you make informed decisions about your health.

CancerProfiling.title: Cancer NGS Profiling
CancerProfiling.description: Advanced genomic analysis for precise insights into tumor behavior and personalized treatment strategies.
CancerProfiling.paragraph1: Cancer is a complex disease that can develop when changes in our DNA disrupt normal cell growth and repair. These genetic changes may be inherited or acquired over time, and understanding them is key to early detection, accurate diagnosis, and effective treatment. With next-generation sequencing (NGS) technology, it's now possible to analyze both inherited and tumor-specific mutations to gain deep insights into cancer risk, tumor behavior, and potential treatment response.
CancerProfiling.paragraph2: ATENA Genomics offers a range of advanced NGS-based cancer testing services — including hereditary cancer screening, tumor profiling, liquid biopsies, and drug resistance monitoring. Each test is designed to support personalized cancer care by providing actionable genetic information that can guide prevention, treatment decisions, and ongoing management.
CancerProfiling.description2: Explore our specialized NGS-based cancer testing services designed to provide comprehensive insights for personalized oncology.

cancerTestingCategories.description2: Explore our comprehensive range of genetic testing options designed to provide insights into various aspects of your health

tumorProfilingNGS.title: Tumor Profiling NGS
tumorProfilingNGS.description: Comprehensive genomic analysis of tumor tissue to identify key mutations.

liquidBiopsiesNGS.title: Liquid Biopsies NGS
liquidBiopsiesNGS.description: Non-invasive cancer detection and monitoring from blood samples.

hereditaryCancerScreening.title: Hereditary Cancer Screening
hereditaryCancerScreening.description: Identification of inherited genetic risk factors for various cancers.

cancerDrugResistanceMonitoring.title: Cancer Drug Resistance Monitoring
cancerDrugResistanceMonitoring.description: Tracking treatment response and identifying resistance development over time.

CancerProfiling.actionHeader: Ready to Discover Your Genetic Profile?
CancerProfiling.actionText: Take the first step towards personalized healthcare with our advanced genetic testing options.

HereditaryCancerScreening.tagline: Simple testing. Powerful knowledge. Healthier choices.
HereditaryCancerScreening.tagline2: Know your genetic cancer risks before symptoms appear
HereditaryCancerScreening.paragraph1: Certain genetic mutations, which can be inherited, can significantly increase the risk of developing cancer, often before any symptoms appear. Through hereditary cancer screening, your DNA is analyzed to identify inherited changes linked to cancers such as breast, ovarian, colorectal, prostate, pancreatic, lung, melanoma, and others.
HereditaryCancerScreening.paragraph2: A simple and non-invasive buccal swab is collected. The DNA from the swab is then analyzed using next-generation sequencing (NGS) technology, allowing you to uncover vital information about your genetic risks.
HereditaryCancerScreening.paragraph3: Depending on your needs, the analysis can focus on specific groups of genes targeted panels, all protein-coding regions whole exome sequencing (WES), or your entire genetic code whole genome sequencing (WGS), providing different levels of detail and insight.
HereditaryCancerScreening.paragraph4: Understanding your genetic profile empowers you to take proactive steps for early detection, prevention, and better health outcomes.
HereditaryCancerScreening.contactHeader: Take Control of Your Cancer Risk
HereditaryCancerScreening.contactText: Discover your hereditary cancer risks and take proactive steps toward prevention and early detection. Knowledge is power when it comes to your health.

ProactiveGenomicHealthScreening.headline: Proactive Genomic Health Screening
ProactiveGenomicHealthScreening.introParagraph1: Your DNA carries valuable information that can help you better understand your health — not only today, but for the future. With Proactive Genomic Health Screening, you have the opportunity to uncover hidden genetic risks before symptoms arise, empowering you to make informed, preventive decisions about your well-being.
ProactiveGenomicHealthScreening.introParagraph2: Using a quick, non-invasive buccal swab (cheek swab), we collect a DNA sample that is analyzed using advanced next-generation sequencing (NGS) technology. This approach allows us to detect a wide range of inherited genetic changes, offering insights into multiple areas of health.
ProactiveGenomicHealthScreening.introParagraph3: Through a single sample, we can screen for potential risks in the following areas:
ProactiveGenomicHealthScreening.paragraph4: Whether you're seeking peace of mind, early awareness, or a deeper understanding of your genetic health, this screening gives you the tools to a proactive role in your health journey — with just one non-invasive test.
ProactiveGenomicHealthScreening.contactHeader: Take Control of Your Genetic Health Journey
ProactiveGenomicHealthScreening.contactText: If you're ready to take the next step or learn more about what this screening can reveal, feel free to contact us. We're here to help guide you through your personalized genomic analysis.

hereditaryCancerScreening.title: Hereditary Cancer Screening
hereditaryCancerScreening.description: Detect inherited mutations that increase the risk of cancers such as breast, ovarian, colorectal, prostate, and others — even before symptoms appear.

neurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.title: Neurological and Neuromuscular Disorders
neurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.description: Identify genetic variants linked to conditions that affect the nervous or muscular systems, helping to uncover personal risk or carrier status.

developmentalIntellectualDisabilities.title: Developmental and Intellectual Disabilities
developmentalIntellectualDisabilities.description: Explore whether you carry genetic changes associated with neurodevelopmental challenges, including learning difficulties and related conditions.

metabolicMitochondrialDisorders.title: Metabolic and Mitochondrial Disorders
metabolicMitochondrialDisorders.description: Gain insight into inherited changes that may affect how your cells produce energy or process key nutrients.

immunologicalDisorders.title: Immunological Disorders
immunologicalDisorders.description: Understand whether your genetic variants related to primary immunodeficiencies that impact immune function.

rareGeneticDisorders.title: Rare Genetic Disorders
rareGeneticDisorders.description: Explore your genome for rare but impactful conditions that may otherwise go undetected or remain unexplained.

pharmacogenomics.title: Pharmacogenomics
pharmacogenomics.description: Learn how your genes influence your response to medications and discover which treatments may be more effective or better tolerated based on your DNA.

NeurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.headline: Genetic Insights into Neurological and Neuromuscular Disorders
NeurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.tagline: Understand your risk before symptoms begin
NeurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.paragraph1: Many neurological and neuromuscular disorders have a genetic basis, caused by inherited changes in DNA that affect nerve or muscle function. Early detection of these genetic variants can help reveal whether you carry changes linked to neurological or neuromuscular conditions — even before symptoms develop. Through advanced genetic testing, your DNA is analyzed using next-generation sequencing (NGS) technology to detect mutations associated with conditions such as muscular dystrophies, hereditary neuropathies, epilepsy syndromes, ataxias, and neurodevelopmental disorders, among others.
NeurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.paragraph2: This analysis is performed using a simple and non-invasive buccal swab, which collects DNA from cheek cells. Depending on the specific condition, the testing may focus on targeted gene panels, whole exome sequencing (WES), or whole genome sequencing (WGS), offering different levels of detail based on clinical need.
NeurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.paragraph3: Genetic insights can help clarify complex symptoms, guide further medical evaluation, and support informed decision-making for long-term care.
NeurologicalNeuromuscularDisorders.contactText: If you're interested in learning more about testing options for neurological or neuromuscular conditions, we invite you to contact us — we're here to help you take the next step.

DevelopmentalIntellectualDisabilities.headline: Understanding Genetic Variants Linked to Cognitive and Developmental Traits
DevelopmentalIntellectualDisabilities.tagline: Know more about the genes that shape your development
DevelopmentalIntellectualDisabilities.paragraph1: Certain genetic changes can influence brain development, learning ability, and cognitive function. Understanding your genetic profile can help reveal whether you carry variants associated with developmental or intellectual disabilities — even if signs have not yet appeared.
DevelopmentalIntellectualDisabilities.paragraph2: Using advanced next-generation sequencing (NGS), your DNA is analyzed to detect inherited changes linked to a wide range of conditions, including autism spectrum traits, global developmental delay, learning difficulties, and other neurodevelopmental challenges
DevelopmentalIntellectualDisabilities.paragraph3: A simple and non-invasive buccal swab is collected to obtain your DNA. Depending on your needs, the analysis may focus on specific genes (targeted panels), all protein-coding regions (whole exome sequencing, WES), or your complete genetic code (whole genome sequencing, WGS), offering different levels of insight.
DevelopmentalIntellectualDisabilities.paragraph4: This information can bring greater clarity to your genetic status and help guide future decisions related to your well-being, learning support, or personal development.
DevelopmentalIntellectualDisabilities.contactText: If you would like to explore this type of testing, feel free to contact us — we’re here to guide you through the next step.

MetabolicMitochondrialDisorders.headline: Genetic Testing for Metabolic and Mitochondrial Disorders
MetabolicMitochondrialDisorders.tagline: Understand your metabolism at the genetic level
MetabolicMitochondrialDisorders.paragraph1: Inherited genetic changes can disrupt how the body produces energy, processes nutrients, or breaks down waste — leading to metabolic or mitochondrial disorders. These conditions often affect multiple organs and systems, sometimes from an early age, and may progress silently before symptoms are noticeable.
MetabolicMitochondrialDisorders.paragraph2: With genetic testing for metabolic and mitochondrial disorders, your DNA is analyzed using next-generation sequencing (NGS) to detect inherited variants linked to issues in energy production, enzyme function, or cellular metabolism. This includes conditions such as mitochondrial encephalopathy, fatty acid oxidation disorders, amino acid metabolism defects, and others.
MetabolicMitochondrialDisorders.paragraph3: A simple and non-invasive buccal swab is collected to obtain your DNA. Depending on your needs, testing can focus on specific metabolic or mitochondrial genes (targeted panels), all protein-coding genes (whole exome sequencing, WES), or your entire genome (whole genome sequencing, WGS), offering varying levels of detail and insight.
MetabolicMitochondrialDisorders.paragraph4: Understanding your genetic profile can help uncover whether you carry changes associated with these complex conditions — even before symptoms appear — giving you the opportunity to make proactive, informed decisions about your health.
MetabolicMitochondrialDisorders.contactText: If you're interested in learning more or starting the testing process, feel free to contact us — we’re here to support you every step of the way.

ImmunologicalDisorders.headline: Explore Your Genetic Risk for Immune System Disorders
ImmunologicalDisorders.tagline: Simple testing for deeper insight into immune-related conditions
ImmunologicalDisorders.paragraph1: Your immune system relies on many genes working together to protect your body. When changes occur in these genes, they can lead to inherited immune conditions that affect how your body responds to infections or immune challenges.
ImmunologicalDisorders.paragraph2: Genetic testing can identify inherited variants linked to primary immunodeficiencies such as severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID), chronic granulomatous disease (CGD), common variable immunodeficiency (CVID), complement deficiencies, and others. Some of these conditions appear early in life, while others may only become noticeable later. In certain cases, you may carry genetic changes without symptoms, but still benefit from knowing your status.
ImmunologicalDisorders.paragraph3: A simple and non-invasive buccal swab is collected to obtain your DNA. This sample is then analyzed using next-generation sequencing (NGS) to look for changes in genes related to immune system function. Depending on your needs, the analysis may use targeted panels, whole exome sequencing (WES), or whole genome sequencing (WGS) to provide different levels of insight.
ImmunologicalDisorders.paragraph4: Understanding your genetic profile can help reveal whether you carry changes that affect immune function — even before symptoms appear. This insight can support proactive, informed decisions about your health.
ImmunologicalDisorders.contactText: If you would like to explore this type of testing, feel free to contact us — we’re here to guide you every step of the way.

RareGeneticDisorders.headline: Find Genetic Clarity for Rare or Unexplained Conditions
RareGeneticDisorders.tagline: One swab. Profound insights into rare conditions
RareGeneticDisorders.paragraph1: Rare diseases are conditions that affect a small portion of the population. A disease is considered rare when it affects fewer than 5 in 10,000 people . Despite their individual rarity, there are an estimated 6,000 to 8,000 distinct rare diseases, collectively impacting between 27 and 36 million people in the EU.
RareGeneticDisorders.paragraph2: Approximately 80% of rare diseases have a genetic origin. These conditions often present complex challenges due to their diverse genetic causes, which can include single-gene mutations, structural changes in chromosomes, or mitochondrial DNA alterations. The variability in symptoms and progression among individuals with the same condition adds to the complexity, making identification and management particularly challenging
RareGeneticDisorders.paragraph3: Genetic testing using next-generation sequencing (NGS) can help identify variants associated with a broad spectrum of rare conditions. This includes syndromes and disorders that are difficult to pinpoint without genetic insight and may otherwise remain unexplained.
RareGeneticDisorders.paragraph4: A simple and non-invasive buccal swab is used to collect your DNA. Testing can be performed using targeted gene panels, whole exome sequencing (WES), or whole genome sequencing (WGS), depending on the level of detail needed.
RareGeneticDisorders.paragraph5: Whether you're exploring the cause of unexplained symptoms or want to understand your genetic status, this testing offers the opportunity for greater clarity and informed decision-making.
RareGeneticDisorders.contactText: If you're considering this type of testing or would like more information, feel free to contact us — we’re here to guide you through the next step.

Pharmacogenomics.headline: Genetic Insights for Safer, Smarter Medication Choices
Pharmacogenomics.tagline: Your genes matter — even when it comes to medicine
Pharmacogenomics.paragraph1: Not all medications work the same way for everyone. Your genes play a key role in how your body processes and responds to certain drugs. Pharmacogenomic testing helps uncover how your DNA influences your response to medications — offering a path toward safer, more effective treatment choices.
Pharmacogenomics.paragraph2: Using a simple and non-invasive buccal swab, we collect your DNA and analyze it with next-generation sequencing (NGS) or targeted genotyping methods. This testing looks at specific genes involved in drug metabolism, such as CYP2D6, CYP2C19, TPMT, and others. The results can help identify which medications may be more effective for you, which may cause side effects, or which may require dose adjustments.
Pharmacogenomics.paragraph3: Pharmacogenomic testing is especially useful when considering medications in areas like:
Pharmacogenomics.paragraph4: Whether you’re just beginning a new treatment or looking to optimize current medications, this test provides valuable insight based on your unique genetic profile.
Pharmacogenomics.contactHeader: Personalize Your Medicine with Genetic Testing
Pharmacogenomics.contactText: If you’re interested in personalized medicine guided by your DNA, feel free to contact us — we’re here to help you take the next step.
